overview:
At 21, Melissa Lim started her career in marketing at Far East Organization, Singapore’s largest private property developer. At Far East Organization, she was responsible for identifying and approaching high-net worth individuals to discuss home and investment opportunities in Asiaâ€™s real estate market.

She then joined JDB Holdings, one of Asia’s fastest growing online media networks covering 9 countries with over 28 million monthly unique visitors. At JDB Holdings, she recruited and mentored a team to help launch OpenRice in Singapore. OpenRice is now Asia’s No. 1 Online Dining Guide with offices in The Philippines, Indonesia, China, Hong Kong and India. She helped devise and execute the operational and marketing strategy to manage and grow a database of over 15,000 restaurant listings, 10,000 user-generated food reviews, 5000 subscribers and 10,000 Facebook fans in less than a year. She expanded the sales offering to include events management, content development, recipes listing and video production and brought in the company’s first sales. She provided the strategic vision and was responsible for creating and maintaining key partnerships. She also interviewed top Celebrity Chefs such as Luke Nguyen and Bobby Chinn. Bobby Chinn has two series of his tv shows on Discovery Network.

In 2011, she accepted the offer to join CozyCot.com, Singapore’s No. 1 Women’s Website as certified by Hitwise. At CozyCot.com, she spearheaded The Women Network: Student Marketing Competition and was on the judging panel for 20 quality student teams. She was also part of the team behind the prestigious annual CozyCot Holy Grail Beauty and Fashion Awards, an event that garnered over 2000 attendees and had over 50 corporate sponsors, including big brand names like L’Oreal, Neutrogena and Sony. She also interviewed Chippendales, Vicki Zhao and Maggie and Annie of Benefit Cosmetics.

Melissa is currently based in Los Angeles (with frequent travels to Silicon Valley) to work on her e-commerce start-up, Beautimy, which plans to bridge the gap between the tech and technologically-backwards multi-billion dollar beauty & personal care industry with mass customization options, beautiful design, excellent customer service, and products handcrafted with high-quality and sustainably-sourced natural ingredients in the USA.
